was directed by accomplished
documentarian steve james and it centers
around william gates and arthur agee two
black teenagers who were recruited to st
joseph high school in westchester
illinois a predominantly white high
school with a stellar basketball program
the film touches on issues concerning
race social class education and more as
the two teenagers deal with changes like
a long commute tough practices and a new
social environment we also watch as
their families handle all the highs and
lows while supporting each other on the
way the project initially began as a
30-minute short film produced for pbs
which was eventually nominated for a
daytime emmy award under the name higher
goals and the making of that special led
to five years of filming and roughly 250
hours of footage that went into making
this documentary hoop dreams premiered
at the sundance film festival in 1994
where it won the audience award for best
documentary and while it was only the
second documentary film ever to get an
oscar nomination for best film editing
it wasn't nominated for best documentary

stars gene hackman as failed college

a winning squad on top of that the
community already doesn't love his
temper or his surprising choice for an
assistant coach the town drunk named
shooter played by dennis hopper the film
was inspired by the 1954 milan high
school team in indiana where they held a
single state basketball championship
from 1954 until 1997 as opposed to the
usual practice of dividing schools up
based on enrollment size with separate
championships it took nearly two years
before producers could finally secure
investors for this film finally getting
a budget of around six million dollars
then it went and grossed over 28 million
dollars impressive for a film that had
to change its title to best shot in some

coach carter this film is based on the
true story of a high school basketball
coach named ken carter who made waves in
1999 after suspending his undefeated
basketball team due to poor academic
results samuel l jackson stars as coach
carter who returns to his old high
school in richmond california
to get the basketball team into shape he
succeeds in setting the players on a
winning streak using tough rules and
discipline but when their grades start
to decline coach carter locks them out
of the gym and shuts down their
championship season he faces criticism
from the players and their parents but
he sticks to his principles insisting
that they should excel in class as well
as on the court the film has a strong
sense of accuracy considering the real
coach carter was on set every day as a
consultant and has said that samuel
